response.raw_message_text:
```json
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Previous Arrests/Convictions", "high", "Two arrests and a conviction indicate a history of lawbreaking, increasing the risk of future offenses."),
    ("Employment Status", "medium", "One job during the year suggests stability but limited work experience and education may impact long-term prospects."),
    ("Education", "low", "High school diploma and college enrollment show some educational attainment, but it is not indicative of specialized skills or advanced degrees."),
    ("Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a non-traditional household can contribute to behavioral issues, but the size and location are not strongly predictive factors."),

}
```

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 3 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
